author: cmpilato
msg: Teach svn_path_splitext() to handle dotfiles correctly.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/path.c
(svn_path_splitext): Effectively ignore the first period in a file's
basename when checking for an extension.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/path-test.c
(test_funcs): No longer expect test_splitext() to fail.

author: ehu
msg: Create backport branch for issue 2751 fix.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/path-test.c
(test_splitext): Fix and grow the dotfile splitext tests.

author: cmpilato
msg: Test how svn_path_splitext() handles dotfiles, too.
In IRC, eh, maxb and I agreed that the file ".foo" has no extension,
and the file ".foo.txt" has an extension of "txt".  However, this is
not how Python's os.path.splitext() handles said files, and so is not
the way I originally wrote svn_path_splitext().  So, expect this test
to fail now until I fix svn_path_splitext().
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/path-test.c
(test_splitext): Test the handling of dotfiles, too.
(test_funcs): Expect test_splitext() to fail now.

author: cmpilato
msg: Finish issue #2474 - Change conflict file naming scheme.
As of this commit, the format chosen for the conflict files is as follows:
FILENAME.rREV[.FILEEXT]
FILENAME.mine[.FILEEXT]
In other words, for extensionless files, there is no change at all.
But for files which have an extension (.doc, .txt, etc.), the
extension is repeated after the ".mine" or ".rREV" revision
indicators.
(Oddly, 'make check' passes without test changes, probably because the
files in our "Greek tree" don't have extensions.)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(merge_file): If the versioned file has an extension (as determined
by svn_path_splitext()), append that extension to the end of the
conflict file names.
